last_episode_to_air.name: In Full Command
last_episode_to_air.overview: After being rejected for a promotion, a disgruntled inspector sees a current case as a way to boost his career.

name: Kojak
overview: Detective Lieutenant Theo Kojak investigates crimes in New York City.

episodes.name: Siege of Terror
episodes.overview: Kojak has two hours to free the hostages from three robbers in an Army surplus store.

episodes.name: Web of Death
episodes.overview: A fellow detective, Nick Ferro, kills his wife's lover and tries to cover it up.

episodes.name: One for the Morgue
episodes.overview: Kojak is suspicious of anonymous tips suggesting that an underworld boss is attempting assassination of his rival which would lead to a mafia war.

episodes.name: Knockover
episodes.overview: A murder victim's diamond ring compounds a homicide case with that of a big robbery.

episodes.name: Girl in the River
episodes.overview: Kojak suspects that the strangler of seven women has returned, when another girl dies in similar circumstances.

episodes.name: Requiem for a Cop
episodes.overview: Kojak races a 48-hour deadline to prevent the burial without honors of his old friend, an officer accused of corruption.

episodes.name: The Corrupter
episodes.overview: Kojak suspects that new store staff may be involved in murder of a jewelry store owner.

episodes.name: Dark Sunday
episodes.overview: The murder of a car thief reveals vital clues to a $500,000 heist.

episodes.name: Conspiracy of Fear
episodes.overview: Kojak tries to hold up an urban re-development project until he solves a murder case.

episodes.name: Cop in a Cage
episodes.overview: Freshly freed from prison, a criminal jailed by Kojak wants revenge and is targeting Kojak's niece on her wedding day.

episodes.name: Marker to a Dead Bookie
episodes.overview: Kojak pretends to be corrupted (buying even more expensive suits than usual and a brand new Cadillac)—not without opposition from Capt. McNeil, who tries save as much police money he can—to catch a narcotics dealer in the act.

episodes.name: Last Rites for a Dead Priest
episodes.overview: During a jeweler's convention, a jewel thief disguises as a priest in order to steal valuable gems.

episodes.name: Death Is Not a Passing Grade
episodes.overview: While teaching a criminal justice class at a local college, Kojak embarrasses a student with a criminal background, forcing him to leave a stolen item to have the upper hand in future classroom discussions.

episodes.name: Die Before They Wake
episodes.overview: A junkie prostitute holds the key which would help solving the murder cases of her roommate and a local TV reporter.

episodes.name: Deliver Us Some Evil
episodes.overview: A small time crook prepares to pull a big robbery to flee a pending murder charge.

episodes.name: Eighteen Hours of Fear
episodes.overview: A woman is coming back from winter holidays from Canada, smuggling two twenty Canadian dollar plates in her fake cast. Once she arrives in US she needs to run from the ex-partner in crime, who murdered her boyfriend and wants get the plates back.

episodes.name: Before the Devil Knows
episodes.overview: A man has embezzled a million dollars in US Government bonds, and David and Kevin burgle the bonds from the safe in his high rise apartment.

episodes.name: Dead on His Feet
episodes.overview: A detective is hiding his terminal illness, while pursuing his partner's murderer. As he knows that he won't make it he's even more motivated to find a murder even if he'll have to pay the highest price.

episodes.name: Down a Long and Lonely River
episodes.overview: A young psychologist asks Kojak for help after her fiancee attempts to settle an old score with the people who left him to take the whole responsibility for the crime which sent him to prison.

episodes.name: Mojo
episodes.overview: Kojak goes undercover as a chemist in order to expose the thieves who stole morphine from an insurance company, to sell it at an inflated price.

episodes.name: Therapy in Dynamite
episodes.overview: A psychopathic bomber targets people who hurt his friend. Kojak must find link between victims in order to find suspect.

episodes.name: The Only Way Out
episodes.overview: A 12-year-old boy wants Kojak's help in locating his missing father. Case takes an interesting twist in which Kojak is not led to the kid's missing father, but to a thief who fled to Brazil with stolen $25 million. With John Hillerman.

episodes.name: The Chinatown Murders (1)
episodes.overview: To head off a bloody war between rival crime families, Kojak must find out who committed a series of murders in Chinatown and bring them to justice.

episodes.name: The Chinatown Murders (2)
episodes.overview: To head off a bloody war between rival crime families, Kojak must find out who committed a series of murders in Chinatown and bring them to justice.

episodes.name: Hush Now, Don't You Die
episodes.overview: Kojak tracks down a college student that he suspects has been raped, but is too afraid to come forward after she witnesses one of the assailants murdered by the other.

episodes.name: A Very Deadly Game
episodes.overview: After a policeman is shot by a local known criminal, Kojak sets out to get the man behind bars, but his efforts are disrupted by FBI agents who are supposed to be helping.   He then pursues the trail alone, taking him to Califormia where the criminal is hiding out.

episodes.name: Wall Street Gunslinger
episodes.overview: Kojak goes undercover as a Greek millionaire to track down the person responsible for the theft of $20 million in securities as well as three murders.

episodes.name: Slay Ride
episodes.overview: When several men fall to their deaths at the same convention, Kojak doubts that mass suicide is the explanation.

episodes.name: Nursemaid
episodes.overview: Kojak and Crocker must protect a bookkeeper from madmen who will stop at nothing to keep her from testifying in court.

episodes.name: You Can't Tell a Hurt Man How to Holler
episodes.overview: Kojak suspects that a small-time criminal was framed for a murder, but the man refuses to cooperate when Kojak tries to prove his innocence.

episodes.name: The Best Judge Money Can Buy
episodes.overview: A judge (John Randolph) whose son was also a judge was murdered and his death was made to look like he had committed suicide. Now, his father must decide whether or not he should allow a murderer (Abe Vigoda) to walk, or risk letting information out that shows his son as a corrupt judge.

episodes.name: A Souvenir from Atlantic City
episodes.overview: Kojak's attempt to solve a terrorist bombing is frustrated by the fact that the only eyewitness is being held incommunicado by the police in another case.

episodes.name: A Killing in the Second House
episodes.overview: Kojak comes up against a former cop, now a private investigator, who tries to make his client's suicide look like murder so he can collect money from life insurance.

episodes.name: The Best War in Town
episodes.overview: A rookie cop (Mark Shea) stumbles upon an attempted murder of a rival gang leader in which he foils, triggering a gang war.

episodes.name: Cross Your Heart and Hope to Die
episodes.overview: A mentally depressed woman (Andrea Marcovicci) witnesses her date being murdered by her neighbor who has an interest in her.

episodes.name: The Betrayal
episodes.overview: An informant (Paul Anka) uses a detective in order to further his way up the criminal ladder.

episodes.name: Loser Takes All
episodes.overview: A woman (Ja'net DuBois) intentionally plots to have her husband murdered during a diamond heist that she had planned with her secret love interest (Leslie Nielson).

episodes.name: Close Cover Before Killing
episodes.overview: Kojak investigates a homicide in which the murder was covered up by a torched building.

episodes.name: Acts of Desperate Men
episodes.overview: An accountant assists a sniper (Bruce Kirby Jr.) on a vendetta.

episodes.name: Queen of the Gypsies
episodes.overview: A young gypsy woman who witnesses a a bank robbery decides that looting banks is preferable to telling fortunes, so she recruits the thieves for a master plan to rob six banks in one day.

episodes.name: Night of the Piraeus
episodes.overview: The murder of a sailor newly arrived on a freighter from Greece and a strangely unconcerned witness lead Kojak to suspect that an object was smuggled into the country in the man's belt.

episodes.name: Elegy in an Asphalt Graveyard
episodes.overview: Kojak is particularly affected by the murder of a beautiful Manhattan playgirl.

episodes.name: The Good Luck Bomber
episodes.overview: Kojak and the bomb squad are stymied by a series of bombs that seemingly can't be defused.

episodes.name: Unwanted Partners
episodes.overview: Crocker fails to believe that his old childhood friend who is  the main focus of a police investigation, could be involved in illegal activity.

episodes.name: Two-Four-Six for Two Hundred
episodes.overview: While an accused thief sits in jail waiting for his lawyer to arrange bail, Kojak tries to decipher a phrase heard during an unsuccessful attempt to steal a paint company truck.

episodes.name: The Trade-Off
episodes.overview: Kojak arrests the ringleader (Mark Stevens) of a drug operation, whose gang kidnaps Captain McNeil's wife in order to trade her for the evidence they have against him.

episodes.name: I Want to Report a Dream
episodes.overview: A psychic (Ruth Gordon)informs police involving a dream in which she sees a murder take place before it ever happened.

episodes.name: A Question of Answers (1)
episodes.overview: An unjustly imprisoned man hopes to clear his name by helping Kojak trap the load shark who framed him.

episodes.name: A Question of Answers (2)
episodes.overview: To clear his name, a man helps Kojak take down a loan shark.

episodes.name: My Brother, My Enemy
episodes.overview: Kojak must overcome outside influences in order to protect a detective (Sylvester Stallone)who accidentally shot a boy.

episodes.name: Sweeter Than Life
episodes.overview: While responding to a homicide call, Kojak discovers his camera that had disappeared earlier at a party in which he, his nephew and friend attended.  His nephew's friend steals the camera and uses it to buy drugs from the murdered man.  They witness the murder and are reluctant to involve the police.  Kojak's nephew must go 'cold turkey' before he ends up like his friend who overdosed.

episodes.name: Be Careful What You Pray For
episodes.overview: Crocker lectures female students on rape at a local catholic school, while two Puerto Rican brothers kill a priest during a truck heist.

episodes.name: Secret Snow, Deadly Snow
episodes.overview: Kojak is determined to nail a big-time drug dealer who shot a plastic surgeon who was already dead from what they first believed to be natural causes.

episodes.name: Life, Liberation, and the Pursuit of Death
episodes.overview: A woman who witnesses a body being dumped into the harbor is so fragile minded that the man who dumped the body tries to use psychology against her in order to eliminate her from the picture.

episodes.name: Out of the Frying Pan . . .
episodes.overview: A veteran cop who is battling alcoholism and demotion after being held responsible for the shooting death of a friend impedes Kojak's murder investigation as he tries to clear his name and win back his shield.

episodes.name: Over the Water
episodes.overview: A mobster's son puts out a contract on Kojak's life after he breaks up a barroom brawl.

episodes.name: The Nicest Guys on the Block
episodes.overview: A colleague of Kojak's, Detective Weaver, discovers that a former high school buddy is now involved in fencing a million dollars' worth of stolen diamonds.

episodes.name: No Immunity for Murder
episodes.overview: Refusing to believe that a prostitute and her partner are responsible for a bookkeeper's murder, Kojak run afoul of the FBI when he tries to investigate further.

episodes.name: A Long Way from Times Square
episodes.overview: Kojak and Crocker head to Cory, Nevada to pick up a witness (Vincent Bagetta), but they encounter trouble in town.

episodes.name: Money Back Guarantee
episodes.overview: A murdered cop and a wealthy young woman put Kojak on the trail of a car-theft ring in which the victims appear to cooperate with the thieves.

episodes.name: A House of Prayer, a Den of Thieves
episodes.overview: An old colleague calls from Las Vegas to say he has captured a counterfeiter Kojak has been looking for, but the elderly man is murdered before Kojak can bring him back to New York.

episodes.name: How Cruel the Frost, How Bright the Stars
episodes.overview: (Christmas Episode) Stavros helps a woman (Betsy Slade) find her desperate boyfriend (Darrell Fetty), while Kojak tries to find out why a man (James Griffith) shot at a woman (Jesse Welles) in a local bar.

episodes.name: The Forgotten Room
episodes.overview: Kojak doubts a young man is guilty in the murder of a prostitute, even the circumstantial evidence points to him.

episodes.name: On the Edge
episodes.overview: Kojak is concerned that a fellow detective's obsessive work habits are endangering both his home life and his career.

episodes.name: A Wind from Corsica
episodes.overview: Kojak must prevent a man from killing the person who framed his recently deceased brother.

episodes.name: Bad Dude
episodes.overview: A private detective recently arrived from the West Coast puzzles Kojak when he appears to be deliberately making himself a killer's next target.

episodes.name: A Grave Too Soon
episodes.overview: Kojak puts the pressure on a known member of an organized crime syndicate when a dead undercover cop is found murdered.

episodes.name: The Frame
episodes.overview: Kojak finds himself under investigation by Internal Affairs when a thief he arrested without sufficient evidence claims he paid Kojak a bribe.

episodes.name: Deadly Innocence
episodes.overview: Kojak investigates the hit-and-run death of a police chemist and uncovers a frame-up.

episodes.name: Justice Deferred
episodes.overview: The discovery of a skeleton at a demolition site reopens an 18-year-old murder case.

episodes.name: Both Sides of the Law
episodes.overview: Kojak competes with a world-famous criminologist to recover five priceless Rembrandt drawings.

episodes.name: Birthday Party
episodes.overview: On her birthday, Kojak's niece is kidnapped by criminals who want to exchange her for an incarcerated cop killer.

episodes.name: A Summer Madness
episodes.overview: Already confronted with problems at home, Detective Jeff Braddock must face the inquiry of the murder of his mistress, while Kojak investigates the bombing of a restaurant.

episodes.name: Law Dance
episodes.overview: Kojak searches for the killer of a key witness in a prominent murder trial.

episodes.name: Out of the Shadows
episodes.overview: Kojak and the detectives scour the city for ""The Grim Reaper"", a slasher who murders his victims out of greed.

episodes.name: A Need to Know
episodes.overview: Kojak and the detectives try to stop a child molester who has diplomatic immunity before he strikes again.

episodes.name: An Unfair Trade
episodes.overview: The shooting of a Puerto Rican youth by the Police anders the community.

episodes.name: A Hair-Trigger Away
episodes.overview: The drug addicted girlfriend of a cop is under scrutiny for accidentally killing his partner during a drug bust.

episodes.name: By Silence Betrayed
episodes.overview: Kojak finds that the longshoreman's lips are sealed when he inquires into labor-related waterfront murders.

episodes.name: A Shield for Murder (1)
episodes.overview: A wealthy political leader quashes Kojak's efforts to reopen a two-year-old matricide case.

episodes.name: A Shield for Murder (2)
episodes.overview: When Kojak gets too close to discovering the truth, he is framed.

episodes.name: The Pride and the Princess
episodes.overview: An émigré princess and her servant scheme to recover family jewels they believe are held by a mobster.

guest_stars.character: Sister Lepar Angelica / Princess Viva Dushan
guest_stars.name: Maria Schell

episodes.name: Black Thorn
episodes.overview: Private eye Salathiel Harms returns, pursuing the same bail jumper as Kojak.

episodes.name: Where Do You Go When You Have No Place To Go?
episodes.overview: A desperate unemployed ironworker accidentally kills a construction kingpin.

episodes.name: Dead Again
episodes.overview: A woman informs the detectives that she had seen a wanted man that had supposedly died in a house fire, but they don't believe her until it's too late.

episodes.name: The Godson
episodes.overview: Kojak's godson becomes mixed up with a gang involved in an armed robbery.  Can Kojak get through to his godson before it's too late?

episodes.name: The Condemned
episodes.overview: A boxer accused of murder holes up inside a church and threatens to kill the parishioners unless the police meet his demands.

episodes.name: When You Hear the Beep, Drop Dead
episodes.overview: A wealthy ecologist's wife plans to murder him and use a fake phone message to frame a nonexistent call girl.

episodes.name: I Was Happy Where I Was
episodes.overview: A Puerto Rican cop goes undercover in his old neighborhood to find out who is trying to start a barrio gang war.

episodes.name: Kojak's Days (1)
episodes.overview: Kojak must unravel the mystery of a white Roll-Royce with a body in the trunk while trying to find a woman who murdered her husband.

episodes.name: Kojak's Days (2)
episodes.overview: The search continues for a woman who murdered her husband, abandoned her child and is threatening to commit suicide.

episodes.name: Monkey on a String
episodes.overview: A member of the police force falls prey to a powerful crime figure. With Albert Paulsen and Judith Light.

episodes.name: Kiss it All Goodbye
episodes.overview: Crocker accidentally shoots a fashion model while trying to stop a robbery, jeopardizing his career.

episodes.name: Lady in the Squad Room
episodes.overview: Kojak and a female detective must overcome their dislike for each other when she is transferred from the rape squad to help nab a drug-dealing rapist-muderer.

episodes.name: Sister Maria
episodes.overview: A vengeful nun tries to bring to justice the gangster who ordered the murder of her sister. (60 mins)

episodes.name: The Queen of Hearts is Wild
episodes.overview: The girlfriend of a local gangster who hates Kojak is the only witness in the murder of a police officer.

episodes.name: A Strange Kind of Love
episodes.overview: A psychotic murderer thinks that a television talk show host is subliminally brainwashing him to murder.

episodes.name: Laid Off
episodes.overview: A laid off police officer with two jobs and a sick wife takes a bribe under pressure from a loan shark.

episodes.name: Cry for the Kids
episodes.overview: A teenager accidentally kills a gangster's hired hand while robbing him, only to have a rival gangster hire him to take out the competition in order to control the neighborhood in which he doesn't own.

episodes.name: Once More from Birdland
episodes.overview: A singer(Andrea Marcovicci) is determined to prove her wrongfully imprisoned father innocent after he spends 14 years in prison.

episodes.name: Caper on a Quiet Street
episodes.overview: A woman is Kojak's only link to finding $6 million dollars, but her boyfriend (Armand Assante) has other plans.

episodes.name: Letters of Death
episodes.overview: Anonymous messages begin turning up informing a model that someone close to her is in danger of being murdered.

episodes.name: Tears for All Who Loved Her
episodes.overview: Crocker (played by Kevin Dobson) falls for a woman (played by Jennifer Warren) while investigating the death of her mobster husband.

episodes.name: The Summer of '69 (1)
episodes.overview: Kojak must reopen a case in which the prime suspect of three women was shot and killed after a shootout with him.  Now, eight years later, the murders have started again and it appears that Kojak may've killed the wrong man.

episodes.name: The Summer of '69 (2)
episodes.overview: After Kojak is placed on suspension, he continues to review the 8-year old case while a serial killer (Stephen McHattie) strikes again.

episodes.name: Case Without a File
episodes.overview: Kojak poses as a murdered private investigator in order to find out why he was murdered.

episodes.name: I Could Kill My Wife's Lawyer
episodes.overview: A detective (Joey Aresco) believes that his wife's divorce lawyer (David Ladd) hired an arsonist to destroy his boat.

episodes.name: Justice for All
episodes.overview: While Kojak is contemplating leaving the police department to become a law firm's investigator, a series of recent drug related deaths begin to overshadow his decision.

episodes.name: Mouse
episodes.overview: Kojak encounters a case where a highly respected surgeon may be doing unnecessary surgeries in order to use the money to pay off gambling debts.

episodes.name: Chain of Custody
episodes.overview: Kojak is suspended after reacting to an incompetent district attorney who failed to convict a known killer.

episodes.name: The Captain's Brother's Wife
episodes.overview: Kojak tries to protect Captain McNeil's widowed sister-in-law from big time gamblers.

episodes.name: No License to Kill
episodes.overview: Kojak offers to help a jealous police officer search for a professional hit man.

episodes.name: The Halls of Terror
episodes.overview: Kojak and the detectives go undercover in a local hospital in order to investigate a string of murders that have been occurring while the victims were on duty.

episodes.name: May the Horse Be With You
episodes.overview: A retired police officer is injured after attempting to prevent the theft of a race horse that he illegally housed in the NYPD stables.

episodes.name: Photos Must Credit Joe Paxton
episodes.overview: A photographer(played by Tige Andrews) becomes the prime suspect in a jewel theft and phony kidnapping of a former actress (played by Antoinette Bower) in which he photographs.

episodes.name: 60 Miles to Hell
episodes.overview: Crocker is taken hostage while trying to transport a prisoner back to New York.

episodes.name: In Full Command
episodes.overview: After being rejected for a promotion, a disgruntled inspector sees a current case as a way to boost his career.
